content: mitt envy in need of a last-minute gift for my mother-in- law it was *cough* december 23rd i whipped up these cabled fingerless mitts using just 2/3 of a skein of koigu the end result was super cute so cute in fact they were really really hard to let go of but i gifted them away…then went out and bought another skein in the exact same colorway to make a pair for myself well it turns out i wasn t the only one with mitt envy just three days after christmas mil emailed me to say when i wear my fingerless gloves i encounter many envious women everybody wants them including sil who would kill for a pair ah nothing like the threat of felonious activity to make a knitter feel good gauge 7 stitches/11 row per inch in stockinette yarn ~32-34 grams of koigu painter s palette premium merino kpppm needles size 1 or whatever floats your gauge boat additional materials 2 stitch markers width should fit hands ~6¾ - 8¼ around just below the knuckles length is 5½ from cuff to cuff note this pattern *looks* long but it s really very intuitive and a quick little knit i ve simply spelled everything out for you because that s how i personally prefer patterns to be tips click here for an excellent tutorial by wendyknits on how to cable without a cable needle these are very easy mod up or down simply adjust the number stitches by multiples of 4 after the cuff distribute them equally as knit stitches on either side of the p1s e g to add 4 stitches knit 2 extra stitches before the first p1 2 after the second p1 c4f same as left twist in the tutorial above using a cable needle slip 2 stitches onto a cable needle and hold in front knit the next 2 stitches then knit the 2 stitches on the cable needle c4b same as right twist in the tutorial above using a cable needle slip 2 stitches onto a cable needle and hold in back knit the next 2 stitches then knit the 2 stitches on the cable needle m1 using the left needle lift the bar between the stitches from front to back then knit this stitch through the back to twist it pattern cast on 52 stitches and join to knit in the round cuff same for both mitts row 1-15 *p2 k2 repeat from * to end left mitt first repeat row 1 2 4 5 6 k8 p1 k12 p1 k to end row 3 k8 p1 c4f k4 c4b p1 k to end row 7 k8 p1 k2 c4f c4b k2 p1 k to end row 8 m1 place marker k8 p1 k12 p1 k to end get a closer look at knittywhipped blogspot com second and third repeat row 1 5 knit all stitches to marker slip marker k8 p1 k12 p1 k to end row 2 4 6 8 m1
